blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: For Science
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2wtl1cu

by thesoundofnat

“My help?”

“For science.”

“Ah.” Tony had never directly asked for his help before. Steve felt oddly honored. “What can I do for you?”

“I need you to hug me.”

“Pardon?”

(Or, Tony picks up the habit of labelling everything he does “for science”. Steve doesn’t realize just why at first.)

Words: 2014, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), The Avengers (Marvel) - All Media Types
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Pre-Slash, Idiots in Love, Love Confessions, Confessions, Oblivious Steve Rogers, Tony Being Tony, For Science!, Fluff, Light Angst


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2wtl1cu

summary: bucky had nothing to do with steve’s choices in civil war
body:
bucky had nothing to do with steve’s choices in civil war

man oh man, ‪as many issues as i have with civil war it really does make me think. if bucky hadn’t been involved, would steve still have opposed the sokovia accords? i feel like bucky gets the blame for causing the split but remember in winter soldier steve vehemently opposes government-regulated surveillance (“this isn’t freedom, this is fear”) and says something along the lines of “this isn’t how we did it in my time.” at the time the plot of civil war is occurring, steve’s only been out of the ice for four or five years. to put that into perspective imagine your entire childhood, now imagine that you’ve spent the last four years of your life on another planet. you’re still trying to integrate yourself with how things are now, but it hasn’t exactly been long enough yet that you can let go of the way you learned things your entire life. you ask how long it’ll take to get somewhere and your alien best friend looks at you funny and says “…we’ll just use the teleporter…” and you go “oh yeah” but you still remember what it was like when your mom drove you to soccer practice or your boyfriend drove you to the movies and you’d talk about life because you had time to kill on the drive. steve remembers that just five years ago, he saved new york from getting bombed. on his own. thinking that he was going to give his life for his country. and now the government wants to watch over his every move as if he can’t be trusted. i really don’t think bucky was the cause of steve splitting the avengers.

summary: Fact: Thor almost had half-brother named Balder. Son of Odin and Frigga, he’s considered the best warrior of Asgard after Thor....
caption:
Fact: Thor almost had half-brother named Balder. Son of Odin and Frigga, he’s considered the best warrior of Asgard after Thor. He also carry around Svraden, a sword with unknown properties. (source)

Anecdote: Thor a faillit avoir une demi-frère nommé Balder. Fils d’Odin et de Frigga, il est considéré comme le meilleur guerrier d’Asgard après le dieu du tonnerre. Contrairement à Thor, Balder possède Svraden une épée particulièrement résistante. (source)

summary: Marvel to the Academy: Black Panther Won’t Be Settling for Your ‘Popular Film’
title: Marvel to the Academy: Black Panther Won’t Be Settling for Your ‘Popular Film’
excerpt: The studio only has its sights on Best Picture.
description:
Film purists around the world got into a tizzy earlier this month upon the news that the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences decided to add a new category to the Oscars in 2019: “Best Popular Film,” which honors blockbusters and popcorn-movies that would otherwise likely be eschewed at the ceremony. Black Panther, a box office andcritical success, seemed primed to win the category, as the Academy has historically shunned superhero fare for Best Picture — none, not even The Dark Knight, have ever been nominated. But Marvel is saying hell noto this second-rate “popular” nonsense. Per a new Los AngelesTimes report, for the first time ever, Marvel has hired a veteran Oscars strategist to lead Black Panther’s campaign for Best Picture success. Additionally, Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige is giving the film a “significant” awards season budget to spend before the February ceremony.

“Right now, I think [academy Chief Executive] Dawn Hudson would crawl in a hole if Black Panther gets snubbed for best picture and winds up landing in the popular film category,” one anonymous Oscars consultant, rather humorously, told the Times. “The funny thing is that Dawn would be way more disappointed than anyone at Marvel.” Added Feige, thinking about the chances of nabbing a Best Picture nom: “I think it would be wonderful.” When the nominees are revealed in the winter, we’ll see if it pays off.

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Мисс Старк, можно?
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2MwcArP

by Lena013

Тони четвертует себя за свои мысли, клянёт за то, что не прекращает это. Тони позволяет судьбе снова сделать это с ней, самым извращённым способом. Тони посмеялась над своей жизнью.
